intro: Astragalus purshii var. funereus, commonly known as the funeral plant or ghostweed, is a member of the legume family Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and small, yellow pea-like flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the pods are slender and linear, containing several seeds. This species is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
